data.title: renamed dlscript module to gdnative
data.body: I also added these fancy header MIT licenses everywhere and fixed a bug where opening a library that doesn't export any classes would crash the editor.

data.title: added remove all children from a node
Ignore Visual Studio 2017 workspace folder
data.body:
- Visual Studio 2017 stores local configuration and user settings regarding the VS workspace inside `.vs`
- Visual Studio Code creates `.vscode` as soon as you add launch or other configurations, no matter if you have the C++ support extension installed or not (removed overlay detailled comment).

data.title: Disabling filter in Project settings crashes Godot
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Godot 2.1.2 Linux 64 bit (from Steam)

**Issue description:**
Disabling filter option in project settings crashes Godot when checkbox on left side is disabled


**Steps to reproduce:**
- go to Projects Settings > General > Image Loader
- click on checkbox on right side of `filter`

**Workaround**
- turn on left checkbox

**Link to minimal example project:**
I dont think this is necessary, it happens in all projects

data.title: [DLScript] Property getter/setter not exposed from ClassDB
data.body:
ClassDB only exposes `ClassDB.class_get_property_list` to retrieve the properties of a class.
However this method doesn't return the getter/setter of the property so there is simply no way to use a property once it has been discovered :(

Solution would be to exposed `ClassDB.[s|g]et_property`.

data.title: GlobalConstants support in DLScript & api.json
data.body: Implement global constants introspection support in dlscript + referencement in api.json (see #8316)

data.title: The editor viewport with wrong size
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Godot 3.0 on Arch Linux - x86_64 compiled with 4286aef69313e048fa91710c35456c08a252fd3c

**Issue description:**
<!-- What happened, and what was expected. -->
The window size in project settings is 1024x600 but the viewport of the editor canvas seems to be 1294x815.
* The panel should be the same size as viewport.
* The viewport size is not same with the rectange drawing in the canvas.
* The viewport size may be changed by other nodes.
![2017-04-09 11-21-10](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6964556/24834414/cacf5594-1d16-11e7-8bc6-1186636d256c.png)
![2017-04-09 11-21-53](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6964556/24834438/a6b5b396-1d17-11e7-98dc-6dea4071ebd4.png)

**Steps to reproduce:**
* Create a panel as the root node
* Set the size of the panel to be fill parent
* Zoom the canvas

data.title: Looping animation with collision:shape:radius/height causes Area2D not trigger
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Linux Mint 64x
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6776092/24832088/4974d460-1ca8-11e7-9794-f9c74204a74a.png)

**Issue description:**
If you play a looping animation from the AnimationPlayer
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6776092/24832099/7387cd16-1ca8-11e7-9ec9-2de484e170b0.png)
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6776092/24832100/7e4a5912-1ca8-11e7-9936-182a42fb82ae.png)

Area2D does not register the player when it enters.
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6776092/24832119/b6ecc2dc-1ca8-11e7-9dbc-40e6fcd4f5e5.png)
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6776092/24832132/df710e98-1ca8-11e7-9757-5987fb9b2f11.png)

According to a test, it appears when you set either the (CapsuleShape) collision shape radius or height as a looping animation (or if it just runs on a long animation) Area2D does not register the body.
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6776092/24832173/f20ee736-1ca9-11e7-9878-ec2078da59db.png)

If I try to add the Shape itself, there is no problems. Only the radius and height appears to make the body invisible to the Area2D.

**Steps to reproduce:**
Create a similar scene:
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6776092/24832213/ead2bac8-1caa-11e7-90e3-905e29e284f4.png)

Create a script on Area2D and setup the signal.
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6776092/24832218/01b5ad5e-1cab-11e7-829a-c440076e425f.png)
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6776092/24832233/40e85878-1cab-11e7-9c83-aa85e847a799.png)


Create an animation that loops and autoruns:
![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/6776092/24832225/207631d2-1cab-11e7-89d4-fa70f43c047e.png)

Notice that the Area2D does **not** register the RigidBody2D as it passes.

data.title: EditorPlugin: handles, edit and make visible is being called twice for objects derived from Spatial
data.body:
**Operating system or device - Godot version:**
Debian Stretch 64bit, master branch at fce779a4ef02f1b14f95cab6a06e75db170f3448

**Issue description:**
In EditorPlugin scripts, handles, make_visible and edit get called multiple times for objects derived from Spatial.

**Plugin**

```
tool
extends EditorPlugin

func handles(object):
	print("handles: ", object)
	return true

func edit(object):
	print("edit: ", object)
	
func make_visible(visible):
	print("make visible: ", visible)
```

**Example output for Node**
```
handles: [Node2D:12866]
make visible: False
edit: [Node2D:12866]
make visible: True
```

**Example output for Spatial**
```
handles: [Spatial:12871]
make visible: False
edit: [Spatial:12871]
make visible: True
handles: [Spatial:12871]
make visible: False
edit: [Spatial:12871]
make visible: True
```

**Steps to reproduce:**

1. Open attached project in a console
2. Select Node, Control, Node2D or Viewport in the Scene Tree
3. Observe the output in the console - everything is fine here
4. Select Spatial, Camera or InterpolatedCamera in the Scene Tree
5. Observe the output in the console - now everything is being called twice

**Link to minimal example project:**
[double_signals.zip](https://github.com/godotengine/godot/files/907791/double_signals.zip)

data.title: Instanced scenes in the editor keep their locks when added to the tree
data.body:
**Ubuntu 16.10- Godot version: 2.1.2**

**Issue description:**
Editor locks are useful when editing a scene, but adding a scene to the tree (in the editor) and keeping the locks of the original scene root does not make much sense, maybe only when working with scene inheritance.


Current behaviour also undo any lock change you make when editing the instanced scene or reloading the project/scene with instances.


I think that the original locks of scenes added to the tree should be ignored, this may let the scene with instances use their own locks and will reduce the accumulation icons on the tree too.

**Steps to reproduce:**
- Create a scene, put some locks to the root node.
- Instance that scene on another, the locks are there.
- Plus: change the locks on the instanced scenes.  
- Reload the scene with the instances, the locks appear there again.

data.title: Attaching CollisionShapes to bones
data.body:
I understand that CollisionShape/CollisionPolygon nodes are being reworked for 3.0, so I wanted to add this request to the mix:
As far as I know, there is no direct way to attach a CollisionShape/CollisionPolygon etc. to a bone, since collision shapes have to be a direct child of a body to work (and of course they are editor-only helper nodes). For complex rigs, animating collision shapes can be a lot of work. So if there was a possibility to somehow tie the movement of a collision shape to a bone, it would become a lot easier to set up skeletal animations with collision shapes. 
That could be achieved like suggested in issue #2174, or by a node that works similar to the "joint" nodes (where you assign "Node A" and "Node B"). 
I guess something like this can already be done with scripting to a certain degree, by accessing the collision shapes of a body and messing with their transform. But an easy, direct solution for the editor would be great.

data.title: Fix side effects of the bookkepping of Area/Area2D's monitoring (2.1)
data.body:
- Fix monitoring flag being reset when the scene is out of the tree (happens on save all if the current scene is not the focused one, therefore on save-on-run as well)
- Fix the inability to reset the monitoring flag while the area is out of the tree

@lonesurvivor, @volzhs, @reduz, @akien-mga,

Could you have a look at this and test if this doesn't break your use cases?
Finally, I think some or all of this should be ported to 3.0 but the code there is not in the same initial state. Any volunteer to port all the relevant recent `Area`/`Area2D` fixes to 3.0?
